intro: Alantsilodendron glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered flame tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, fiery red flowers that appear in dense clusters during the spring and summer seasons. The plant has a woody stem with smooth, grayish bark and large, palmate leaves that are deeply lobed. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. Alantsilodendron glomeratum is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
